definition: stegosaurus
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long

sentences.english: The Stegosaurus had a very small brain and was not smart.
sentences.chinese: 劍龍的腦袋非常小，所以不太聰明。

sentences.english: It was like scaling the spikes of a Stegosaurus.
sentences.chinese: 就像是在攀登劍龍的背鋒。

sentences.english: The Stegosaurus was a well-equipped fighter.
sentences.chinese: 劍龍是個一個全副武裝的戰士。

sentences.english: Other dinosaurs that lived at the same time were Stegosaurus and Iguanodon.
sentences.chinese: 其它生活在這個時期的恐龍有劍龍和禽龍。

sentences.english: Scientists do not know what the bony plates on the back of the Stegosaurus were for.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們不知道劍龍背上的這些板狀的骨頭有什麼用。

sentences.english: Stegosaurus lived in the Jurassic period, the middle period of dinosaur history.
sentences.chinese: 劍龍生活在恐龍時代的中期侏羅紀時代。

sentences.english: The Stegosaurus uses them for protection.
Tyrannosaur Rex was a terrible king, stegosaur's tail could really swing.
sentences.chinese: 暴龍雷克王，劍龍的尾巴確實能搖擺。
劍龍的行爲舉止什麼樣？

sentences.english: James Cheng and Lin Ting Yao. There are 3 computers packed in two cartons.
sentences.chinese: 陳劍龍與林延耀，三個電腦包裝在兩個大紙箱。

sentences.english: Stegosaurus was one of the many plant-eating dinosaurs.
sentences.chinese: 劍龍也是食草恐龍之一。

definition: random jottings/travel notes
Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
gifted or skillful writing
writing on the ground with a large brush dipped in water
woodcut/wood engraving
Herman or Hermann (name)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper

lit. three humble visits to a thatched cottage/cf famous episode in the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义 in which Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 recruits Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮 (the Hidden Dragon 臥龍|卧龙) to his cause by visiting him three times
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
secondary normal school (abbr. for 中等師範學校|中等师范学校[zhong1 deng3 shi1 fan4 xue2 xiao4])
Horizontal Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
Concise History of the Chinese Novel by Lu Xun 鲁迅
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Xiao3 shuo1 Shi3 lu:e4

definition: see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
posthumous (painting, calligraphy, prose etc)
